thread.title: Police: 16-year-old arrested for burning cat in Bremerton
thread.title_full: Police: 16-year-old arrested for burning cat in Bremerton | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Police: 16-year-old arrested for burning cat in Bremerton
text:
A 16-year-old has been arrested for animal cruelty.
According to the Kitsap Humane Society, the boy was interviewed and arrested for burning a cat on the grounds of Bremerton High School.
The boy admitted using butane as an accelerant.
He will not be identified, as he is a juvenile, according to the humane society.
Sorry for the unedited photo. My fault. @BremertonPD looking for 2 people who set cat ablaze near HS Tennis courts pic.twitter.com/X3gtpzauh3
— Terry Griffin (@TerryKIRO7) October 6, 2015 The cat was set on fire near the school’s tennis courts.
According to police, the boy will be held in juvenile holding pending review and consideration of a charge of Felony First Degree Animal Cruelty by the Kitsap County Prosecutor's Office.
“This outrageous act against a defenseless animal would make anyone angry, but the response shows how many caring people there are out there. Diligent work by our officers, detectives and Kitsap Humane Society Animal Control led to this case being solved, and we deeply appreciate the concern and assistance of the public,” said Bremerton Police Chief Steve Strachan in a press release.
Two persons in the area of the cat being burned Sun night- very grainy but if you have info please call 360-473-5349 pic.twitter.com/GV2TAjfGyk
— Bremerton Police (@BremertonPD) October 6, 2015 “Kitsap County is a community of animal lovers, and the quick justice brought in this case shows that our community will not stand for animal cruelty,” wrote Natalie Smith, Director of Animal Control and Animal Welfare at Kitsap Humane Society.
